availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. J. Denham (Edmonson County, KY, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Edmonson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Luther Denham and Sarah Denham. Laborer in Edmonson County in 1860. Convicted of assault and battery in Edmonson County in 1861. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and blacksmith from November 17, 1862, to August 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 98.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 116.
"Thomas Andrew Jackson Denham (1837-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 148987375, accessed March 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/148987375.
